bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 14, 1896

div1.p: Lazear writes that he has seen his uncle, Thomas Lazear. He also discusses financial issues relating to real estate.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 14, 1896
div1.p:
I got a
letter from you a
few days ago. I
hope you are feeling
better now.

It has been rather
cold here for some
time and you are probably
having the same sort
of weather.

I was out to see
Uncle Tom twice.
He seems rather
cheerful and pleased
with the way things
are going. Some
Washington people
have been talking of
buying 40 acres of
Windsor. The rail-
road was nearly
finished on Wednesday
and I have no
doubt cars will
be running this week. It goes
as far as the hill near the
race bridge. It is a continuation
of the Edmondson Ave line.
I had thought it was to
connect with the North Ave
line. I like the present
arrangement better as it will
be better for getting to the hospital
and also for going down
town.

A letter came from Cousin Jess
this morning saying that he
had an offer of $21000 for the
Frankstown Ave property. This
will net $14.500. I shall
accept the offer. At 6% this
will bring in $900 a year.

Uncle Tom came on
chiefly on the Waynesburg
business. He found
the evidence here that
he wanted.

I expect I shall
stay at Windsor a
few days after I
leave the hospital.
However, direct
letters here until
I tell you otherwise.
I shall try to see
the Turnbulls and the Keighlers
this week.
